channel.title: Prof Cruz — Thinking in Systems
channel.description: Notes on strategy, governance, institutional transformation, and the architecture of learning by Richard Cruz.

item.title: EDSA at 40: What an Event Can't Fix
item.description: A four-part structural reflection on EDSA — not commemoration, but a framework for understanding why political resets don't automatically produce durable transformation, and what small experiments might actually compound into institutional depth.

item.title: Why Transformation Programs Fail Before They Start
item.description: Most organizational transformations don't fail in execution. They fail in framing — the moment leaders confuse activity-based planning with genuine strategic architecture.

item.title: Governance Is Not Compliance
item.description: When boards treat governance as a compliance checklist, they create the illusion of oversight while systematically undermining institutional coherence.

item.title: The Rigidity Trap: When Success Becomes the Problem
item.description: Organizations that succeed through operational discipline often build the exact structures that prevent them from adapting when the environment shifts. This is the rigidity trap — and escaping it requires a fundamentally different logic.
